data.title: Kelly Clarkson's surprise donation will help Iowa family rebuild after fire destroys home
data.meta_description: A Norwalk family recently experienced unexpected tragedy. This week, they received a surprise donation during \
data.text:
Iowans are making more appearances on this season of "The Kelly Clarkson Show." This week, a family from Norwalk who had experienced a recent tragedy got a surprise from the music star during her weekday talk show.

The Des Moines Gay Men's Chorus appeared on an episode of the show in March ahead of a Kelly Clarkson-themed concert.

Norwalk teachers lose home in January fire

On Jan. 14 this year, longtime teachers Jennifer Ghelf, Dean Lange and their daughter Faith experienced an unexpected tragedy.

After Faith smelled smoke in their home, her mother found the walls around their fireplace in flames. KCCI reported that Ghelf and Faith immediately evacuated with their pets. Lange was out running errands.

The fire spread, and despite all efforts, the house was a loss.

A former student set up a GoFundMe to support the family. Within two days, it had almost $35,000 donated.

Kelly Clarkson gives Norwalk, Iowa family an unexpected donation

Ghelf, Lange and Faith appeared on an episode of "The Kelly Clarkson Show" that aired Tuesday for a segment on their resilience.

After sharing their story on the show, the family received an unexpected surprise: a $25,000 gift from Kidde, a fire safety product company.

Ghef, Lange and Faith said their plans for building a dream home are already in the works.

How to watch Norwalk, Iowa family on 'The Kelly Clarkson Show'

New episodes of "The Kelly Clarkson Show" air weekdays at 3 p.m. on KCCI in central Iowa. Replays of past episodes, including the one featuring Ghelf and the Langes can be found on NBC.com and Peacock.
